listitem.para:
how many bytes can be sent/received on the inbound or outbound SA of a particular instance of a connection (a set of encryption/authentication keys for user packets) , from successful negotiation to expiry; acceptable values are an integer optionally followed by KiB, MiB, GiB, TiB, PiB or EiB to signify kilobytes, megabytes, gigabytes, terabytes, petabytes or exabytes.
This is in addition time based rekey. Normally, the connection is renegotiated (via the IKE SA) before ipsec-max-bytes value is reached. This option is not negotiated and both ends use their own value for this option.

The value set two triggers. The number of bytes allowed to be encrypted with the same key, ie hard expire and a soft limit. The soft limit is 80% of ipsec-max-bytes + random value derived using rekeyfuzz. An IPsec SA uses a different key for inbound and outbound. Thus a value of 1GiB means that no rekey is triggered yet when the inbound is 600MiB and the outbound is 500MiB - while the interface has seen 1.1GiB of traffic. Soft limit will trigger when traffic in direction exceeds 800MiB (plus random 10-20%). Also the initiator is preferred to rekey before the responder.
